content.description: A spring with a spring constant of <math alttext="32 newtons per meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>32</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></math> is attached to a wall. A block of mass <math alttext="2.0 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mtext>2.0</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> is connected to the free end of the spring, as shown. The block is displaced <math alttext="0.20 meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> from the equilibrium position of the block-spring system which is located at <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mstyle> </math>. The block is released from rest, and it oscillates on a horizontal surface where friction between the surface and the block is negligible.
content.question: How far is the block from the equilibrium position <math alttext="3.0 seconds" overflow="scroll"> <mn>3.0</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>s</mtext> </math> after being released?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
